ext_descriptions.ext_description: The equivalence_boolean_value is used for selecting Boolean measured value.

The equivalence_detected_difference_select allows selection of the type of detected difference.
The detected difference may be the measured value that causes inequivalence defect, or the measured value that is close to the threshold though not within the specified range. The detected difference is represented by the attribute
of an entity
referred from the .
The equivalence_measured_value_select allows selection of the type of measured value that shall be calculated by equivalence validation software based on the inspection requirement.
The target_annotated_3d_model_select allows selection of annotated 3d model data to be inspected.

An A3m_equivalence_inspected_element_pair is a type of
that represents a pair of inspected elements.
As for the correspondence between compared_elements and comparing_elements, there are various cases. 1-1 correspondence, such as one occurrence in the compared assembly model corresponds to one occurrence in the comparing model will be the most probable and desirable case. But, one occurrence in the compared model may be split into two occurrences in the comparing model by translation. In this case, the correspondence becomes 1-2 correspondence. In general, 1-N correspondence, M-1 correspondence, and even N-M correspondence is probable. In order to cope with these cases, EXPRESS specification of this entity becomes as shown below.
the data elements in the comparing model to compare with the compared_elements.
the data elements in the compared model to compare with the comparing_elements.

ext_description.p:
An instance of this entity shall not be used as
of the .

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
An A3m_equivalence_inspection_criterion_report is a type of
that represents summary information of the inspection results for one specific criterion. This entity may report how many instances were inspected and how many instances among them were found to have inequivalence defects with regard to the criterion via .

one or more
that shows an integer value representing
or , or any measured value calculated.

An A3m_equivalence_inspection_criterion_report_item is a type of
and abstract supertype of ,
and .

specifies an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the A3m_equivalence_inspection_criterion_report_item is dependent on the existence of the
that specifies the A3m_equivalence_inspection_criterion_report_item as its .

An instance of this entity shall not be used as
of the .

An A3m_equivalence_inspection_instance_report is a type of
that represents detailed information of inspection result in entity instance level for one specific criterion. Inspection is made against each instance element of the product data concerned. This entity contains a list of s, each representing the inspection result for an instance or a pair of instances of the inspected product data.
The order of s, in the list of inspected_instances attribute is specified by
as defined in
Annotated_3d_model_equivalence_criteria_arm.
a list of s, each representing the inspection result for a pair of instances of the inspected product data.

An A3m_equivalence_inspection_instance_report_item is a type of
that represents a detailed inspection result for a pair of inspected elements of the specified product data.
An instance of this entity may be created for each pair of entity instances inspected. Usage of instances of this entity can be controlled by
defined in
that has attributes to require a report on all inspected elements or only on elements with inequivalence defect, number of elements to be reported and expected report sequence.

an
that represents data types of a pair of elements inspected.

ext_description.p: a value obtained by the inspection.
ext_description.note:
The types of inspected_element and measured_value_for_inspected_element are specified in each
entity defined in .

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
An instance of this entity shall not be used as
of the .

An A3m_equivalence_inspection_report is a type of
that represents an inspection report with respect to one specific criterion.

an
for which the inspection report is presented.

An instance of this entity shall not be used as
of the .

An A3m_equivalence_inspection_result is a type of
that represents the result of inspection regarding specified criterion.

the criterion represented by
for which the inspection was performed.

An instance of this entity shall not be used as
of the .

An A3m_equivalence_inspection_result_representation is a type of
that represents inspection results for the specified product data equivalence criteria against specific pair of product data instances. It consists of one or more s, each corresponding to a specific criterion.
the criteria against which the inspection was performed.

At least one instance of
referenced from an A3m_equivalence_inspection_result_representation shall be of type .

An A3m_equivalence_inspection_result_with_judgement is a type of
that contains information on whether the data inspected have passed or failed the test for the criterion.

ext_description.p:
a boolean value representing the fact whether the result of inspection satisfies the data equivalence criterion specified by
or not. The value is TRUE when an equivalence concern represented by the criterion is detected and FALSE otherwise.
ext_description.note:
When the judgement is not required or is not available for some reasons such as incomplete inspection, an instance of
shall be used instead of this entity.

Expression of judgement depends on each application. This attribute is provided as a default representation of judgement. Developers of Application Protocols using this standard may create its own judgement representation based on the detailed information available from
and its subtypes, if required.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
An A3m_inspected_model_and_inspection_result_relationship is the relationship between
and the target annotated 3d model represented by .
target annotated 3d model data type that will be defined in detail via .

ext_description.note:
Shape data, Assembly data and PMI data are regarded as major constituents of annotated 3d model data in this standard. Therefore, annotated_3d_model_equivalence_shape module, annotated_3d_model_equivalence_assembly module and annotated_3d_model_equivalence_pmi module
are provided as companion standards of this standard.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: A Criterion_report_item_with_measured_value is a type of . It reports summarized inspection result for a specific criterion together with a measured value obtained.
a measured value to report.
the type of a representative_measured_value to report.

The combination of
and value_type shall be unique within a population of Criterion_report_item_with_measured_value.

A Criterion_report_item_with_number_of_instances is a type of
that represents a
that implies
or .

a
that shows the number of inspected elements or the number of defects depending on the selection by value_type.

a
that shows the meaning of statistical_value.

The combination of
and value_type shall be unique within a population of Criterion_report_item_with_number_of_instances.

A Criterion_report_item_with_value is a type of
that represents any measured value calculated for the criterion.

a
that shows a representative value of inspected instances whose meaning is shown by value_type.

a
that shows the meaning of report_value.

The combination of
and value_type shall be unique within a population of Criterion_report_item_with_value.

An Equivalence_instance_report_item_with_notable_instances is a type of
and has the information on pairs of notable measured value and difference information.

a list of
that represent pairs of notable measured value and difference information detected by the inspection. The notable value is the measured value that causes satisfaction of the criterion, or the measured value that is closest to the threshold when the criterion is not satisfied.

An Equivalence_notable_instance is a difference information including notable measured value.
When different shape data are compared, difference information will become location information where notable measured value(s) are detected.
As for the correspondence between compared_elements and comparing_elements, there are various cases. For detecting correspondence between two face sets of the compared manifold solid B-rep and comparing manifold solid B-rep having similar spatial extent, the notable instances are faces in both manifold solid B-reps. One face in the compared model may be split into two faces in the comparing model by translation. In this case, the correspondence becomes 1-2 correspondence. In general, 1-N correspondence, M-1 correspondence, and even N-M correspondence is probable. For detecting removed and added faces of the compared manifold solid B-rep, LIST[0:?] is used. The reason why LIST[0:?] is used both for compared_elements and comparing_elements is to cope with no correspondence cases though both of them are not allowed to be 0 at the same time, because that is unrealistic.

a list of
that is the difference information of the comparing model.

a list of
that is the difference information of the compared model.

ext_description.p: the notable value obtained by the inspection.
ext_description.example: When a significant deviation between two arc-wise connected surfaces is detected, the difference information will be location information that comprise two points, one on each surface. The notable value represented by the measured_value is the distance between these two points.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: Either the size of comparing_elements or that of compared_elements shall be non-zero.
